title: A techno-economic model for avoiding conflicts of interest between owners of offshore wind farms and maintenance suppliers. (arXiv:2401.08251v1 [cs.GT])
abstract: Currently, wind energy is one of the most important sources of renewable energy. Offshore locations for wind turbines are increasingly exploited because of their numerous advantages. However, offshore wind farms require high investment in maintenance service. Due to its complexity and special requirements, maintenance service is usually outsourced by wind farm owners. In this paper, we propose a novel approach to determine, quantify, and reduce the possible conflicts of interest between owners and maintenance suppliers. We created a complete techno-economic model to address this problem from an impartial point of view. translated_title: 一种避免海上风力发电场主和维护供应商利益冲突的技术经济模型
translated_abstract: 目前，风能是最重要的可再生能源之一。由于其众多优势，海上风力涡轮机位置的利用逐渐增加。然而，海上风场需要大量投资进行维护服务。由于其复杂性和特殊要求，风场维护服务通常是外包的。本文提出了一种新的方法，以公正的观点确定、量化和减少风场主和维护供应商之间可能存在的利益冲突。我们建立了一个完整的技术经济模型来解决这个问题。开发了一个迭代过程，以获得可以帮助利益相关者协商合同条款的统计结果，其中风场的可用性是通过确定惩罚和激励措施的参考参数。此外，还解决了一个多目标规划问题，旨在使双方的利润最大化，而不会失去。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种技术经济模型，以避免海上风力发电场主和维护供应商之间的利益冲突，通过在合同中使用风场的可用性作为参考参数来确定惩罚和激励措施，从而帮助利益相关者协商合同条款。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces a techno-economic model to avoid conflicts of interest between owners of offshore wind farms and maintenance suppliers by using the availability of the wind farm as a reference parameter to determine penalties and incentives in the contract, thus helping stakeholders negotiate contract terms.
